analyzed: de zhig bsgom par bya ba'i gnas sa phyogs dben zhing sems nyams dga' bar dri rnam pa lngas byugs te /

analyzed: stan 'jam zhing rgya che ba la brtul zhugs can gyis mnyam par gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: de'i lte ba la yi ge hr'i: dmar po rnam par bsam mo //

analyzed: yi ge hr'i: de las 'od zer gyi dra ba byung bas phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams la phog ste /
translated: From that syllable hrīḥ, a net of light rays shines forth, touching the realms of sentient beings in the ten directions.

original: dpal ku ru kulle'i gzugs su mngon par byas nas /
analyzed: dpal ku ru kulle'i gzugs su mngon par byas nas /
translated: Having manifested in the form of Śrī Kurukullā,

original: 'od zer gyi phreng ba de dag kyang yang 'dus te /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi phreng ba de dag kyang yang 'dus te /
translated: those garlands of light rays gather together again.

original: de nyid du zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on her entering into that.

original: de nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la lha mo ku ru kulle ma lo bcu drug pa lta bu 'bar ba'i dbu skra kham pa gyen du brjes pa /
analyzed: de nas mdun gyi nam mkha' la lha mo ku ru kulle ma lo bcu drug pa lta bu 'bar ba'i dbu skra kham pa gyen du brjes pa /
translated: Then, in the space in front, the goddess Kurukullā, who is like a sixteen-year-old girl, with hair blazing orange and standing upward,

original: thod pa lngas dbu la brgyan pa /
analyzed: thod pa lngas dbu la brgyan pa /
translated: her head adorned with five skulls,

original: ro'i steng du skyil mo krung phyed mar gar kyi  stabs su bzhugs pa /
analyzed: ro'i steng du skyil mo krung phyed mar gar kyi  stabs su bzhugs pa /
translated: standing in a dancing posture on a corpse with one leg bent,

original: mche ba cung zad gtsigs shing lce lcib par mdzad pa /
analyzed: mche ba cung zad gtsigs shing lce lcib par mdzad pa /
translated: her fangs slightly bared, her tongue rolled up,

original: 'khor lo dang / snyan cha dang / mgul chu dang / dpung rgyan dang / phyag gdub dang / ska rags dang / zhabs gdub kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang / snyan cha dang / mgul chu dang / dpung rgyan dang / phyag gdub dang / ska rags dang / zhabs gdub kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with a wheel, earrings, necklace, armlets, bracelets, belt, and anklets,

original: stag gi sham thabs can spyan dmar po g-yo zhing 'dril ba /
analyzed: stag gi sham thabs can spyan dmar po g-yo zhing 'dril ba /
translated: wearing a tiger-skin skirt, her red eyes darting and rolling,

original: mtha' yas mgon gyis dbu la brgyan pa /
analyzed: mtha' yas mgon gyis dbu la brgyan pa /
translated: her head adorned by Ananta,

original: phyag bzhi la gnyis kyis autpala dmar po kha ma bye ba'i mde'u dang ldan pa'i mda' dang / me tog dmar po'i gzhu'i mda' gzhu 'gegs pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi la gnyis kyis autpala dmar po kha ma bye ba'i mde'u dang ldan pa'i mda' dang / me tog dmar po'i gzhu'i mda' gzhu 'gegs pa /
translated: her four arms holding a bow and arrow with a red-lotus bud-tipped arrow and a bow with a red flower,

original: lhag ma'i phyag gnyis na me tog dmar po'i lcags khyu dang autpala bsnams pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i phyag gnyis na me tog dmar po'i lcags khyu dang autpala bsnams pa rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the remaining two hands hold a red-flowered iron hook and a blue lotus.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ku ru kulle ma la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ku ru kulle ma la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to make offerings to the Blessed Lady Kurukullā,

original: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: las byung ba'i mchod pa'i me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri dang lha bshos rnam pa lngas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: las byung ba'i mchod pa'i me tog dang bdug spos dang mar me dang dri dang lha bshos rnam pa lngas mchod par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings with the five offerings of flowers, incense, lamps, perfume, and food, which arise from the letter hrīḥ located in one’s heart on a sun maṇḍala.

original: 'di ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mchod pa'o //
translated: This is the offering.

original: mchod pa byas nas dam pa'i snying rje dang lan pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: mchod pa byas nas dam pa'i snying rje dang lan pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: Having made the offering, the yogin who is endowed with the compassion of the supreme vehicle

original: lus ngag yid gsum gyis gus pas btud de phyag bya'o //
analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum gyis gus pas btud de phyag bya'o //
translated: should bow with devotion in body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ni phyag btsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyag btsal ba'o //
translated: This is the prostration.

original: phyag btsal nas sdig pa bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag btsal nas sdig pa bshags par bya ste /
translated: Having made the prostration, one should confess one’s sins.

original: sdig pa gang bgyis bgyid du stsal ba dang / bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa de dag bcom ldan 'das ma'i spyan sngar mngon sum du bshags par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sdig pa gang bgyis bgyid du stsal ba dang / bgyid pa la rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa de dag bcom ldan 'das ma'i spyan sngar mngon sum du bshags par bgyi'o //
translated: Whatever evil I have done, caused to be done, or consented to, I confess it all in the presence of the Blessed Lady.

original: 'di ni sdig pa bshags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa bshags pa'o //
translated: This is the confession of evil.

original: de nas bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams la rjes su yi rang bar bya ste /
translated: Next, one should rejoice in merit.

original: brtul zhugs can gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams gang lags pa de dag la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: brtul zhugs can gyis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsod nams gang lags pa de dag la bdag rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: O one of firm observances, I rejoice in whatever merit the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas have.

original: de ni bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: This is rejoicing in merit.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ste /
translated: Next, one should go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon @246a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon @246a * //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha Jewel, the Dharma Jewel, and the Sangha Jewel.

original: mchog rnams la gang du 'khor ba nas 'khor ba'i tshe bdag skyabs su mchi bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: mchog rnams la gang du 'khor ba nas 'khor ba'i tshe bdag skyabs su mchi bar bgyi'o //
translated: Wherever I may be in cyclic existence, I go for refuge.

original: 'di ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: This is going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: Then one should generate the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: gang dag srid pa'i 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams drang par bya ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag srid pa'i 'khor ba na gnas pa'i sems can rnams drang par bya ba de'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of leading all sentient beings who abide in the cycle of existence,

original: bdag gi gtso bo thugs rdo rje bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi gtso bo thugs rdo rje bya'o //
translated: one should be the mind-vajra, the chief of oneself.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: This is the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then one should cultivate the four abodes of Brahma.

original: sems can thams cad la bu gcig ba ltar gdung bar sems pa gang yin pa'i sems su bsgom pa 'di ni btang snyoms bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bu gcig ba ltar gdung bar sems pa gang yin pa'i sems su bsgom pa 'di ni btang snyoms bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of equanimity is the cultivation of the mind which is concerned with all sentient beings as if they were one's only child.

original: de nas de rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs shing lus dang bral bar byed pa 'di ni stong pa nyid sgom pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs shing lus dang bral bar byed pa 'di ni stong pa nyid sgom pa'o //
translated: Then, the cultivation of emptiness is the non-apprehension of all those by way of their intrinsic reality, and the freedom from the body.

original: de nas sems tsam du ni byin gyis brlab pa'i gsang sngags aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sra bh'a wa a'a tma konyam zhes bya ba 'dis sems byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sems tsam du ni byin gyis brlab pa'i gsang sngags aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sra bh'a wa a'a tma konyam zhes bya ba 'dis sems byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: Then, the consecration of the mind as mere consciousness is the consecration of the mind with the mantra Om shunyatagatavajra-svaha.

original: de nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don la blo yis gzigs nas sngags pa lha'i skur bskyed de /
analyzed: de nas sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis sems can gyi don la blo yis gzigs nas sngags pa lha'i skur bskyed de /
translated: Then, by the power of former aspirations, having seen with the mind the benefit to sentient beings, the mantra practitioner generates the deity's body.

original: gsang sngags sbas pa'i rim pa 'di ni lha'i sku zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags sbas pa'i rim pa 'di ni lha'i sku zhes bya'o //
translated: This stage of the secret mantra is called the deity's body.

original: de nas nam mkha'i ngos su yi ge ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer dra ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i ngos su yi ge ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'od zer dra ba'i phreng bas 'khrigs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, on the surface of the sky, one should meditate on a sun maṇḍala arisen from the syllable raṃ, blazing with a garland of radiating light rays.

original: 'di ni nyi ma shar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyi ma shar ba'o //
translated: This is the rising sun.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um kha dog nag po yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um kha dog nag po yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: On top of that, from the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, which is black in color,

original: sna tshogs rdo rje las rdo rje ra ba dang / rdo rje gur dang / rdo rje bcing ba dang / sa gzhi rdo rje ra rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje las rdo rje ra ba dang / rdo rje gur dang / rdo rje bcing ba dang / sa gzhi rdo rje ra rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should imagine a vajra ground, a vajra tent, a vajra fence, and a vajra floor arisen from a vajra cross.

original: 'di ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsrung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: This is the protection wheel.

original: de'i dbus su chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi ye shes yi ge ae lta bu kha dog dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi ye shes yi ge ae lta bu kha dog dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of that, one should meditate on the gnosis of the source of phenomena, which is like the syllable e, white in color.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge hr'i: dmar po las byung ba'i padma dmar po 'dab brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge hr'i: dmar po las byung ba'i padma dmar po 'dab brgyad pa /
translated: In its center, from a red letter HRĪḤ, is an eight-petaled red lotus.

original: de'i snying po'i steng du yi ge ram las yongs su gyur pa'i nyi ma dang ro'o //
analyzed: de'i snying po'i steng du yi ge ram las yongs su gyur pa'i nyi ma dang ro'o //
translated: In its center, from a letter RAṂ, is a sun and corpse.

original: gzhan yang de dag gi steng du mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i zla ba nya gang zhing yongs su rdzogs pa dkar po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag gi steng du mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan pa'i zla ba nya gang zhing yongs su rdzogs pa dkar po'o //
translated: Moreover, above them is a full, complete, white moon with the thirty-two marks.

original: de'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i ngo bo kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i ngo bo kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: Above that is a red sun maṇḍala, the nature of the eighty minor marks.

original: de dag gi bar du yi ge hr'i: kha dog dmar po yongs su gyur pa'i autpala dmar po kha ma 'bus pa'i nang du rang gi sems nyid zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bar du yi ge hr'i: kha dog dmar po yongs su gyur pa'i autpala dmar po kha ma 'bus pa'i nang du rang gi sems nyid zhugs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In between them, from a red letter HRĪḤ, is a red utpala flower that has not yet opened, inside of which is one’s own mind.

original: de nas zla ba dang dbyangs dang nyi ma rnams gcig tu zhu ba'i bdag nyid las sdon du brjod pa lta bu'i lha mo ku ru kul+le'i sku bsgom par @246b bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba dang dbyangs dang nyi ma rnams gcig tu zhu ba'i bdag nyid las sdon du brjod pa lta bu'i lha mo ku ru kul+le'i sku bsgom par @246b bya'o //
translated: Then, the moon, the vowels, and the sun melt into one taste, and from that arises the form of the goddess Kurukullā, as described previously.

original: rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: Having visualized that,

original: snying gar yi ge ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de'i lte bar hr'i: yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar yi ge ram las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de'i lte bar hr'i: yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: At the heart one should meditate on the syllable raṃ, from which arises a sun mandala, in the center of which is hriḥ.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis mgon po mtha' yas bkug ste /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyis mgon po mtha' yas bkug ste /
translated: One should summon the infinite protector with its light rays.

original: spyan drangs nas mchod pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: spyan drangs nas mchod pa 'dzin pa rnams kyis yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Having invited him, one should make offerings with the offering goddesses.

original: dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab po //
analyzed: dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab po //
translated: One should request the empowerment.🔽The request is “Empower me, O immortal one.”

original: gsol ba gdab pa ni aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am aa mri ta n'a tha zhes bya ba des mtha' yas kyi sa bon gyi bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i bum pa thugs ka nas 'phro bar bsgoms te /
analyzed: gsol ba gdab pa ni aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am aa mri ta n'a tha zhes bya ba des mtha' yas kyi sa bon gyi bdud rtsi lngas yongs su gang ba'i bum pa thugs ka nas 'phro bar bsgoms te /
translated: With that, one should meditate on the seed syllable of Amitābha, from which light radiates and fills the vase with the five elixirs.

original: de nas bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pas dbang bskur zhing blugs pas bdag gi snying gar bum pa rnams zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i bum pas dbang bskur zhing blugs pas bdag gi snying gar bum pa rnams zhugs te /
translated: Then, having been empowered and filled with the vase filled with the five elixirs, the vases enter one’s heart.

original: zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyi bor mtha' yas bsgom mo //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i spyi bor mtha' yas bsgom mo //
translated: Having entered, one should meditate on Amitābha at the crown of the yogin.

original: dus gsum du 'di bsgom zhing lha mo'i gsang sngags ba zlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du 'di bsgom zhing lha mo'i gsang sngags ba zlas brjod bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on this in the three times and recite the secret mantra of the goddess.

original: de la gsang sngags ni aom ku ru kul+le hr'i: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de la gsang sngags ni aom ku ru kul+le hr'i: sv'a h'a /
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ kuru ku llé hriḥ svāhā.

original: lhag par yang tsandan dmar po'i phreng bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par yang tsandan dmar po'i phreng bas bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: In particular, one should recite it with a rosary of red sandalwood.

original: kha zas rnams ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bdud rtsis nan tan gyis sbyong ste /
analyzed: kha zas rnams ye shes rnam pa lnga'i bdud rtsis nan tan gyis sbyong ste /
translated: One should purify all foods with the five-branch awareness elixir.

original: aom a'a: h'um de nyid gsum pa 'dis kha zas dang zhal byin gyis brlabs na 'dis zhal gyi gsang sngags 'grub po //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um de nyid gsum pa 'dis kha zas dang zhal byin gyis brlabs na 'dis zhal gyi gsang sngags 'grub po //
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. With this triple-reality one should bless the food and mouth. By this the mantra of the mouth is accomplished.

original: de nas sngags pas skyes pa'am bud med dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas sngags pas skyes pa'am bud med dbang du bya bar 'dod na /
translated: Then, if the mantrin wishes to enthrall a man or woman,

original: yar gyi ngo'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te bzlas brjod khri bya ste /
analyzed: yar gyi ngo'i tshes gcig nas brtsams te bzlas brjod khri bya ste /
translated: beginning on the first day of the waxing moon, one should recite [the mantra] ten thousand times.

original: dus gsum du bcom ldan 'das ma'i skur dmigs te /
analyzed: dus gsum du bcom ldan 'das ma'i skur dmigs te /
translated: In the three periods [of the day] one should visualize the form of the Blessed Lady.

original: smad dkris ras dmar po dang / lus la ras dmar po gyon nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa rtsa ba 'dam nas skyes pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: smad dkris ras dmar po dang / lus la ras dmar po gyon nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i yi ge hr'i: dmar po yongs su gyur pa las padma dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa rtsa ba 'dam nas skyes pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: He is wearing a red lower garment and a red upper garment. In his heart is a red letter hrīḥ on a sun disk, which transforms into a red eight-petaled lotus with its roots growing from a swamp.

original: 'dab ma de rnams la dbyangs kyi yi ge dang po brgyad las yongs su gyur pa'i bung ba brgyad khro zhing rgyas pa dga' zhing chags par rim pa bzhin bsams nas dbugs kyis bskyod de /
analyzed: 'dab ma de rnams la dbyangs kyi yi ge dang po brgyad las yongs su gyur pa'i bung ba brgyad khro zhing rgyas pa dga' zhing chags par rim pa bzhin bsams nas dbugs kyis bskyod de /
translated: On those petals are eight bees that have arisen from the first eight vowels. They are wrathful, plump, passionate, and in sequence. Imagine that they are shaken by the breath.

original: sna bug nas byung nas bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yas par zhugs nas sgra sgrogs shing gar byas te gdungs shing padma'i 'dab ma la yang dbyangs yig dang po brgyad kha dog cung zad dmar ba dang ldan pa rnam par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sna bug nas byung nas bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yas par zhugs nas sgra sgrogs shing gar byas te gdungs shing padma'i 'dab ma la yang dbyangs yig dang po brgyad kha dog cung zad dmar ba dang ldan pa rnam par blta bar bya'o //
translated: They emerge from the nostrils and enter the right nostril of the victim. They make a sound, dance, and are passionate. On the lotus petals are the first eight vowels, slightly red in color.

original: de ltar bltas nas de nas rnal 'byor pas autpala kha ma 'bus pa'i mde'u dang ldan pa'i mda' lta stangs dang bcas pa'i khu tshur gyis rdzogs par bkang ste /
